Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported APIs which the application can invoke in order to use the driver.

Function Documentation

int32_t EDMA_chainChannels ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint16_t  fromParamId,
uint8_t  toChannelId 
)

Description
Chain channels.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open.
[in]fromParamIdParam Id of the channel from which to chain.
[in]toChannelIdchannel Id of the channel to which to chain to.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes

Description
Close EDMA instance.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_configChannel ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
EDMA_channelConfig_t const *  config,
bool  isEnableChannel 
)

Description
Configure a channel.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open.
[in]configpointer to EDMA_channelConfig_t_
[in]isEnableChannelset to true if you want to enable the channel after configuration else set to false. For false case, it is expected that the channel will be enabled at a later time using EDMA_enableChannel for event triggered DMA channel events or QDMA channels. Note for DMA events that are intended not to be event triggered i.e manual triggered or chain triggered only, this flag should be set to false else a real event appearing on the event line may unintentionally trigger the DMA channel.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_configErrorMonitoring ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
EDMA_errorConfig_t const *  config 
)

Description
Configure Error monitoring. The EDMA IP has several features for monitoring errors in the CC and TC as described in EDMA UG :

  • Missed events.
  • Exceeding of queue threshold.
  • Bus error caused due to read/writes in transfers where addresses go out of bounds of physical memory (i.e where EDMA IP does not get any ACK back).
  • Read/writes to invalid/reserved addresses in CC/TC register memory map.
  • Exceeding of outstanding transfer controller codes.
    This API allows selective control (where available in h/w) of what to monitor. It should be called during init time. It is important to issue this API for safety, besides being useful in debugging.
Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open.
[in]configpointer to error configuration EDMA_errorConfig_t_.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_configParamSet ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint16_t  paramId,
EDMA_paramConfig_t const *  config 
)

Configure Param Set

Parameters

int32_t EDMA_configPerformance ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
EDMA_performanceConfig_t const *  config 
)

Description
Configure Performance parameters. This is useful for performance tuning of transfer controllers relative to each other and priority of EDMA issue on the bus with respect to rest of IPs for memory access.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open.
[in]configPerformance configuration input.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_disableChannel ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  channelId,
uint8_t  channelType 
)

Description
Disable a channel.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open
[in]channelId0 to (EDMA_NUM_DMA_CHANNELS - 1) when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA.
0 to (EDMA_NUM_QDMA_CHANNELS - 1) when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA.
[in]channelTypechannelType can be either EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA or EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes

uint8_t  channelId,
uint8_t  channelType 
)

Description
Enable a channel.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open.
[in]channelId0 to (EDMA_NUM_DMA_CHANNELS - 1) when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA.
0 to (EDMA_NUM_QDMA_CHANNELS - 1) when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA.
[in]channelTypechannelType can be either EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA or EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_getErrorStatus ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
bool *  isAnyError,
EDMA_errorInfo_t *  errorInfo 
)

Description
Query Error Status of EDMA. This API is used for polling and getting EDMA error status if poll indicates there was an error. This is useful in some devices where the EDMA's error interrupt is not physically wired to the interrupt controller of the processor but EDMA peripheral registers are accessible. When interrupt is connected, this API is not necessary because the error ISR will call out the user provided call back function (EDMA_errorConfig_t::callbackFxn) when issuing EDMA_configErrorMonitoring.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open
[out]isAnyErrortrue if any EDMA error is detected, else false
[out]errorInfoPointer to error information, this is populated if any EDMA error is detected.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
uint8_t EDMA_getNumInstances ( void  )

Description
Get number of EDMA instances on the device.

Return values
Numberof EDMA instances.
int32_t EDMA_getStatusInfo ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
EDMA_statusInfo_t *  status 
)

Description
Query Status of EDMA. This is useful for debugging/diagnostic purposes. Typically called in the implementation of the error call back function of the application supplied in the EDMA_errorConfig_t_::callbackFxn and/or EDMA_errorConfig_t_::transferControllerCallbackFxn when issuing EDMA_configErrorMonitoring, for additional post-mortem analysis.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open
[out]statusstatus output
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_getTransferControllerErrorStatus ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  transferControllerId,
bool *  isAnyError,
EDMA_transferControllerErrorInfo_t *  errorInfo 
)

Description
Query Error Status of EDMA's transfer controller. This API is used for polling and getting EDMA transfer controller error status if poll indicates there was an error. This is useful in some devices where the EDMA's transfer controller interrupt is not physically wired to the interrupt controller of the processor but EDMA peripheral registers are accessible. When interrupt is connected, this API is not necessary because the error ISR will call out the user provided call back function (EDMA_errorConfig_t::transferControllerCallbackFxn) when issuing EDMA_configErrorMonitoring.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open
[in]transferControllerIdTransfer Controller Id
[out]isAnyErrortrue if any EDMA transfer controller error is detected, else false
[out]errorInfoPointer to error information, this is populated if any EDMA error is detected.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_init ( uint8_t  instanceId)

Description
Initialize specified EDMA instance. Performs the following:

  • Disables and clears events.
  • Disables and clears interrupts.
  • Clears error state.
  • Sets all PaRAM sets to all zeroes (hardware reset state).
Parameters
[in]instanceIdId of the instance to be initialized.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_isTransferComplete ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  transferCompletionCode,
bool *  isTransferComplete 
)

Description
Query for transfer completion. This function will return an error if transfer completion callback function for the supplied transferCompletionCode is configured as non NULL. This is because the burden of clearing the channel is not in the call back but in the driver after the user supplied call back is called. So polling on a cleared channel would give wrong result i.e indicate transfer is not complete even when it has completed. The call back completion and this API are exclusionary.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open
[in]transferCompletionCodewhich transfer completion code to query, range is [0,(EDMA_NUM_TCC - 1)]
[out]isTransferCompletetrue if transfer is complete, false otherwise. NOTE: If true, then IPR(H) bit of the completed transfer will be cleared, allowing for a new transfer to complete.
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_linkParamSets ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint16_t  fromParamId,
uint16_t  toParamId 
)

Description
Link Param Sets.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open.
[in]fromParamIdParam Id from which to link
[in]toParamIdParam Id to which to link
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
EDMA_Handle EDMA_open ( uint8_t  instanceId,
int32_t *  errorCode,
EDMA_instanceInfo_t *  instanceInfo 
)

Description
Open a specified EDMA instance.

Parameters
[in]instanceIdInstance Id to open, range is [0, number of instances-1], where number of instances is obtained from a call to EDMA_getNumInstances.
[out]errorCodeOne of Error Codes if there is an error, otherwise EDMA_NO_ERROR.
[out]instanceInfoInstance information.
Return values
Handleto the EDMA instance. If errorCode returns an error i.e is not EDMA_NO_ERROR, then handle is NULL.

int32_t EDMA_startDmaTransfer ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  channelId 
)

Description
Start a DMA channel transfer. It is a simpler/faster version of EDMA_startTransfer when channel is known to be of type DMA.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open.
[in]channelId0 to (EDMA_NUM_DMA_CHANNELS - 1)
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_startFinalQdmaTransfer ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  channelId 
)

Description
Start final QDMA transfer. It modifies OPT field's STATIC bit to 1 before triggering QDMA, useful for multi-transfer type configurations (A-type transfer where the product of bCount and cCount is greater than 1 or AB-type transfer where cCount is greater than 1) where last but one transfer must have STATIC bit to be 0 and the last transfer needs STATIC to be 1 to prevent a NULL transfer error.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open
[in]channelId0 to (EDMA_NUM_QDMA_CHANNELS - 1)
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_startQdmaTransfer ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  channelId 
)

Description
Start a QDMA channel transfer. It is a simpler/faster version of EDMA_startTransfer when channel is known to be of type QDMA.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the EDMA instance obtained through call to EDMA_open
[in]channelId0 to (EDMA_NUM_QDMA_CHANNELS - 1)
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
int32_t EDMA_startTransfer ( EDMA_Handle  handle,
uint8_t  channelId,
uint8_t  channelType 
)

Description
Start a transfer.

Parameters

[in]channelId0 to (EDMA_NUM_DMA_CHANNELS - 1) when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA
0 to (EDMA_NUM_QDMA_CHANNELS - 1) when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA
[in]channelTypechannelType can be either EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA or EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA
Return values
Success- EDMA_NO_ERROR
Error- one of Error Codes
